item.title: Sherry add a quote by William Stafford
item.description: "...What you fear will not go away; it will take you into yourself and bless you and keep you. That's the world, and we all live there." -- William Stafford

item.title: Sherry add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "She had come to that state where the horror of the universe and its smallness are both visible at the same time—the twilight of the double vision in which so many elderly people are involved. If this world is not to our taste, well, at all events, there is Heaven, Hell, Annihilation—one or other of those large things, that huge scenic background of stars, fires, blue or black air. All heroic endeavour, and all that is known as art, assumes that there is such a background, just as all practical endeavour, when the world is to our taste, assumes that the world is all. But in the twilight of the double vision, a spiritual muddledom is set up for which no high-sounding words can be found; we can neither act nor refrain from action, we can neither ignore nor respect Infinity." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Sherry add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "In Europe life retreats out of the cold, and exquisite fireside myths have resulted—Balder, Persephone—but [in India] the retreat is from the source of life, the treacherous sun, and no poetry adorns it because disillusionment cannot be beautiful. Men yearn for poetry though they may not confess it; they desire that joy shall be graceful and sorrow august and infinity have a form, and India fails to accommodate them." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Sherry add a quote by E. M. Forster
item.description: "They had started speaking of “women and children”—that phrase that exempts the male from sanity when it has been repeated a few times. Each felt that all he loved best in the world was at stake, demanded revenge, and was filled with a not unpleasing glow, in which the chilly and half-known features of Miss Quested vanished, and were replaced by all that is sweetest and warmest in private life. “But it’s the women and children,” they repeated, and the Collector knew he ought to stop them intoxicating themselves, but he hadn’t the heart." -- E. M. Forster

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Let no man pull you so low as to hate him." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "I have decided to stick to love...Hate is too great a burden to bear." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Ezra Pound
item.description: "Rhythm <i>must</i> have meaning." -- Ezra Pound

item.title: Sherry add a quote by W. H. Auden
item.description: "Every poet has his dream reader: mine keeps a look out for curious prosodic fauna like bacchics and choriambs." -- W. H. Auden

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "I am his Highness' dog at Kew; Pray tell me, sir, whose dog are you?" -- Alexander Pope

item.title: Sherry add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "Words ought to be a little wild for they are the assault of thoughts on the unthinking." -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "You cannot do a kindness too soon, for you never know how soon it will be too late." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Muriel Rukeyser
item.description: "If there were no poetry on any day in the world, poetry would be invented that day. For there would be an intolerable hunger." -- Muriel Rukeyser

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Muriel Rukeyser
item.description: "Always our wars have been our confessions of weakness" -- Muriel Rukeyser

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "The exceeding brightness of this early sun Makes me conceive how dark I have become." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Seamus Heaney
item.description: "I suppose I'm saying that defiance is actually part of the lyric job" -- Seamus Heaney

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Eugene V. Debs
item.description: "Intelligent discontent is the mainspring of civilization." -- Eugene V. Debs

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Muriel Rukeyser
item.description: "We are against war and the sources of war. We are for poetry and the sources of poetry." -- Muriel Rukeyser

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Muriel Rukeyser
item.description: "I think there is choice possible at any moment to us, as long as we live. But there is no sacrifice. There is a choice, and the rest falls away. Second choice does not exist. Beware of those who talk about sacrifice" -- Muriel Rukeyser

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Natasha Trethewey
item.description: "I don't like a kind of workshop that is about editing--I don't want to sit there and be an editor. I don't want to tell someone how to "fix" a poem." -- Natasha Trethewey

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Marcel Duchamp
item.description: "Art is not about itself but the attention we bring to it." -- Marcel Duchamp

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Edward Hirsch
item.description: "Works of art imitate and provoke other works of art, the process is the source of art itself." -- Edward Hirsch

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Alicia Ostriker
item.description: "The appropriation of the creativity-procreativity metaphor by women is a conscious challenge to traditional poetics and beyond that to traditional metaphysics, for the gynocentric vision is not that Logos condescends to incarnate itself, but that Flesh becomes Word." -- Alicia Ostriker

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "From oriole to crow, note the decline In music. Crow is realist. But, then, Oriole, also, may be realist." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "A pear should come to the table popped with juice, Ripened in warmth and served in warmth. On terms Like these, autumn beguiles the fatalist." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "Poetry is a finikin thing of air That lives uncertainly and not for long Yet radiantly beyond much lustier blurs." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "We say God and the imagination are one . . . How high that highest candle lights the dark." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Muriel Rukeyser
item.description: "As we live our truths, we will communicate across all barriers, speaking for the sources of peace. Peace that is not lack of war, but fierce and positive." -- Muriel Rukeyser

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Alicia Ostriker
item.description: "With women poets we look at or into, but not up at, sacred things; we unlearn submission." -- Alicia Ostriker

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Alicia Ostriker
item.description: "To Wallace Stevens' post-Nietzschean formula 'God and the imagination are one,' these women poets would add a crucial third element: God and the imagination and <i>my body</i> are one." -- Alicia Ostriker

item.title: Sherry add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "Children picking up our bones Will never know that these were once As quick as foxes on the hill;" -- Wallace Stevens
